messages.subject: Re: Boy Books
messages.msgSnippet: Hi all: Thanks so much for your suggestions. We ve already read as many of the Redwall books as we can handle--they start seeming too much alike after a while.
messages.messageBody:
Hi all:

Thanks so much for your suggestions. We've already read as many of the
Redwall books as we can handle--they start seeming too much alike after a
while. My older son loved THE OTHER SIDE OF THE MOUNTAIN when he was about
that age, but my younger one is fixated on the animal adventures at the
moment. I think it's because it is less threatening to him if something bad
happens to one of the characters.

I can't believe I didn't think of BEN AND ME and MR REVERE AND I, since I
carry them in the store. There is another one about Columbus' dog, too.
Perfect solutions, thanks once again.

Ricka Gerstmann
